intro: Glandularia cochabambensis, commonly known as the Cochabamba glandularia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Bolivia. It belongs to the tribe Cardueae within the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features glandular hairs on its stems and leaves, which may play a role in water retention or chemical defense. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in summer, adding a subtle ornamental value to its natural habitat.
